00079     template<class T>
00080     static inline T stringTo( string input, bool& success, bool printDebug = true )
00081     {
00082         success = true;
00083         try
00084         {
00085             return lexical_cast<T>( input ); 
00086         }
00087         catch( const exception& e )
00088         {
00089             logger.print( "Warning: in Utility::stringTo<T>, cast failed: " + lexical_cast<string>(e.what()) + " input was: " + input, printDebug );
00090             T t;
00091             success = false;
00092             Utility::setDefaultValue( t );
00093             return t;
00094         }
00095     }

00106     static inline string toString( T type, bool& success, bool printDebug = true )
00107     {
00108         success = true;
00109         try
00110         {
00111             return lexical_cast<string>( type ); 
00112         }
00113         catch( const exception& e )
00114         {
00115             logger.print( "Warning: in Utility::toString<T>, cast failed ", printDebug );
00116             logger.print( "Warning: the reason given was: " + lexical_cast<string>(e.what()), printDebug );
00117             success = false;
00118             return "";
00119         }
00120

00155     static inline vector<string> globFiles( string pattern, bool printDebug )
00156     {
00157         glob_t pglob;
00158 
00159         int ret = glob( pattern.c_str(), GLOB_TILDE | GLOB_MARK, NULL, &pglob );  
00160         vector<string> files;
00161 
00162         if( ret == 0 )
00163         {
00164             for( unsigned int i = 0; i < pglob.gl_pathc; ++i )
00165             {   
00166                 string file = pglob.gl_pathv[i];
00167                 files.push_back( file ); 
00168             }
00169         }
00170         logger.print( "Error: error in globfiles", ret != 0 && printDebug );
00171 
00172         globfree( &pglob );
00173         
00174         return files;
00175         
00176         
00177     }

00186     template <class T>
00187     static inline vector<T> parseVector( const string& vec, bool& success, bool printDebug, char delim = ',' )
00188     {
00189         vector<T> ret;
00190         for( unsigned int i = 0; i < vec.size(); ++i )
00191         {
00192             string entry = "";
00193             while( i < vec.size() && vec[i] != ',' )
00194             {
00195                 entry += vec[i];
00196                 ++i;
00197             }
00198             success = false;            
00199             T tmp;
00200             tmp = stringTo<T>( entry, success, printDebug );
00201             if( !success )
00202             {
00203                 logger.print( "Warning: conversion failed in parseVector", printDebug );
00204                 return ret;
00205             }
00206             ret.push_back( tmp );
00207         }
00208         success = true;
00209         return ret;
00210     }

00212     static inline unsigned int zeroOut( unsigned long& pos )
00213     {
00214         if( pos == string::npos )
00215             pos = 0;
00216         return pos;
00217     }

00219     static inline string makeTabs( unsigned int count )
00220     {
00221         string ret;
00222         for( unsigned int i = 0; i < count; ++i )
00223         {
00224             ret += "    ";
00225         }
00226         return ret;
00227     }

00229     static inline string trim( const string& s )
00230     {
00231         if( s.length() == 0 )
00232         {
00233             return s;
00234         }
00235 
00236         unsigned long firstNotWhite = s.find_first_not_of( " \t\n" ); 
00237         zeroOut( firstNotWhite );
00238 
00239         unsigned long lastNotWhite = s.find_last_not_of( " \t\n" );
00240         zeroOut( lastNotWhite );
00241         
00242         return s.substr( firstNotWhite, lastNotWhite - firstNotWhite + 1 );
00243     }

00250     template <class T>
00251     static inline vector<T> split( const string& vec, bool& success, const string& delims = "," )
00252     {
00253         vector<T> list;
00254         char_separator<char> sep( delims.c_str() );
00255         tokenizer< char_separator<char> > tokens( vec, sep );
00256         tokenizer< char_separator<char> >::iterator i = tokens.begin();
00257         for( ; i != tokens.end(); ++i )
00258         {
00259             T tmp;
00260             tmp = stringTo<T>( Utility::trim(*i), success, true );
00261             list.push_back( tmp );
00262         }
00263         return list;
00264     }

00271     {
00272         bool success = false;
00273         return split<T>( vec, success, delims );

00284     template <class K, class V>
00285     static inline map<K,V> parseMap( const string& mapString, 
00286                        bool& success, bool printDebug, char itemDelim = ',',
00287                        char pairStartDelim = '(', char pairEndDelim = ')' )
00288     {
00289         success = true;
00290         map<K,V> ret;
00291         for( unsigned int i = 0; i < mapString.size(); ++i )
00292         {
00293             while( i < mapString.size() && mapString[i] != pairStartDelim )
00294             {
00295                 ++i;
00296             }
00297 
00298             if( i < mapString.size() && mapString[i] == pairStartDelim )
00299             {
00300                 ++i;
00301             }
00302 
00303             string keyString = "";
00304             while( i < mapString.size() && mapString[i] != itemDelim )
00305             {
00306                 keyString += mapString[i];
00307                 ++i;
00308             }
00309             K key;
00310             key = Utility::stringTo<K>( keyString, success, printDebug ); 
00311             if( !success )
00312             {
00313                 logger.print( "Warning: conversion of " + keyString + " to a key failed in parseMap, typename of key is:" + typeid(K).name(), printDebug );
00314                 return ret;
00315             }
00316 
00317             string valueString = "";
00318             //skip over the deliminator
00319             if( i < mapString.size() && mapString[i] == itemDelim )
00320             {
00321                 ++i;
00322             }
00323             while( i < mapString.size() && mapString[i] != pairEndDelim )
00324             {
00325                 valueString += mapString[i];
00326                 ++i;
00327             }
00328             V value;
00329             value = Utility::stringTo<V>( valueString, success, printDebug ); 
00330             if( !success )
00331             {
00332                 logger.print( "Warning: conversion of " + valueString + " to a value failed in parseMap, typeid of value is: " + typeid(V).name(), printDebug );
00333                 return ret;
00334             }
00335 
00336             ret[key] = value;
00337         } 
00338 
00339         return ret;
00340     }

00350     template <class T>
00351     static inline string vectorToString( const vector<T>& vec, bool& success, string delim = ",", bool doDelim = true )
00352     {
00353         string temp;
00354         success = false;
00355         for( unsigned int i = 0; i < vec.size(); ++i )
00356         {
00357             if( !doDelim )
00358             {
00359                 temp += Utility::toString<T>( vec[i], success, true );
00360                 if( !success )
00361                 {
00362                     logger.print( "Warning: in Utility::assembleVector, failed to convert type to string" );
00363                     return "";
00364                 }
00365             }
00366             else
00367             {
00368                 if( i != 0 )
00369                 {
00370                     temp += (delim + Utility::toString<T>( vec[i], success, true ));
00371                 }
00372                 else
00373                 {
00374                     temp += Utility::toString<T>( vec[i], success, true );
00375                 }
00376                 if( !success )
00377                 {
00378                     logger.print( "Warning: in Utility::assembleVector, failed to convert type to string" );
00379                     return "";
00380                 }
00381             }
00382         }
00383 
00384         return temp;
00385     }

00402     template <class K, class T>
00403     static inline string mapToString( const map<K,T>& hash, bool& success, string itemDelim = ","
00404                         , string pairStartDelim = "(", string pairEndDelim = ")"  )
00405     {
00406         string ret = "";
00407         success = true;
00408         ostringstream ostream1;
00409         ostringstream ostream2;
00410         for( typename map<K,T>::const_iterator i = hash.begin(); i != hash.end(); ++i )
00411         {
00412             ostream1 << (*i).first;
00413             ostream2 << (*i).second;
00414             ret += pairStartDelim + ostream1.str() + itemDelim + ostream2.str() + pairEndDelim;
00415             ostream1.str( "" );
00416             ostream2.str( "" );
00417         }
00418 
00419         return ret;
00420     }

00428     static inline int getRandomInteger( int offset, int range, bool print_debug )
00429     {
00430         if( range <= 0 ) 
00431         {
00432             logger.print( "Warning: passed a range of: " + lexical_cast<string>(range) + " to getRandomInteger, returning zero", print_debug );
00433             return 0;
00434         }  
00435         timeval t;
00436         gettimeofday( &t, NULL );
00437         unsigned int seed = t.tv_usec;
00438         return offset + rand_r( &seed ) % range;
00439     }

00445     template <class K, class T>
00446     static inline vector<K> getMapKeys( const map<K,T>& hash )
00447     {
00448         vector<K> keys;
00449         for( typename map<K,T>::const_iterator i = hash.begin(); i != hash.end(); ++i )
00450         {
00451             keys.push_back( (*i).first );
00452         } 
00453 
00454         return keys;
00455     }

00466     
00467     static inline Ogre::Vector3 toVector3( const vector<double>& vec )
00468     {
00469         Ogre::Vector3 ret;
00470         if( vec.size() < 3 )
00471         {
00472             logger.print( "Warning: Utility::vectorToVector3, argument less then 3 dimensions, returning empty Vector3" );
00473             return ret;
00474         }
00475 
00476         ret.x = vec[0];
00477         ret.y = vec[1];
00478         ret.z = vec[2];
00479         return ret;
00480     }
